meanings.definition: To make a thin shallow cut or mark on the surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The cat scratched the door to ask to come inside.
meanings.sent2: I scratched my arm on a thorn while gardening.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy scratched 'I love you' on the sand with its paw.
meanings.sent4: Her words scratched at his heart, leaving invisible marks.
meanings.sent5: The old tree trunk was scratched with initials of long-forgotten lovers.

meanings.definition: To rub or scrape a surface with something sharp or rough.
meanings.sent1: She scratched the itch on her back with a ruler.
meanings.sent2: The chef scratched the burnt bits off the pan with a metal spatula.
meanings.sent3: The bear scratched its back against the tree trunk like a giant backscratcher.
meanings.sent4: The harsh wind scratched the paint off the old wooden fence.
meanings.sent5: The child scratched the frost off the car window to peek outside.

meanings.definition: To damage or mar the surface of something by scraping or rubbing.
meanings.sent1: The careless mover scratched the antique table while carrying it upstairs.
meanings.sent2: The keys scratched the surface of the phone when dropped on it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon scratched graffiti on the trash cans with its claws.
meanings.sent4: The constant use of the old pen scratched the paper, leaving a trail of ink.
meanings.sent5: The heavy furniture scratched the hardwood floor, leaving visible marks.
